html:
388 U.S. 465

87 S.Ct. 2128

18 L.Ed.2d 1323

William HEMPHILL
v.
ILLINOIS.

No. 1342, Misc.

Supreme Court of the United States

June 12, 1967

William Hemphill, pro se.

William G. Clark, Atty. Gen. of Illinois, for respondent.

On Petition for Writ of Certiorari to the Supreme Court of Illinois.

PER CURIAM.

1

The motion for leave to proceed in forma pauperis and the petition for a writ of certiorari are granted. The judgment is vacated and the case is remanded to the Supreme Court of Illinois with instructions to appoint counsel and hear the appeal. Milani v. Illinois, 386 U.S. 12, 87 S.Ct. 874, 17 L.Ed.2d 702.

388 U.S. 465 (1967)

HEMPHILL
v.
ILLINOIS.

No. 1342, Misc.

Supreme Court of United States.

Decided June 12, 1967.
ON PETITION FOR WRIT OF CERTIORARI TO THE SUPREME COURT OF ILLINOIS.

Petitioner pro se.

William G. Clark, Attorney General of Illinois, for respondent.

PER CURIAM.

The motion for leave to proceed in forma pauperis and the petition for a writ of certiorari are granted. The judgment is vacated and the case is remanded to the Supreme Court of Illinois with instructions to appoint counsel and hear the appeal. Milani v. Illinois, 386 U. S. 12.
